0.title: NASA conducts last major test before Moon mission launch
0.article_body: NASA has started conducting the "last major test" before the launch of its upcoming Moon mission. It's having a "wet dress rehearsal" for its Space Launch System rocket. It's designed to launch NASA's new crew capsule called Orion, which will carry future astronauts to Moon. It'll launch Orion, without any crew inside, on a four-to six-week-long mission around the Moon.

1.title: Forest official cycles 294 km from Pune to Kolhapur to take charge
1.article_body: Nanasaheb Ladkat, a 59-year-old forest officer in Maharashtra, cycled from Pune to Kolhapur to take charge at his new posting as field director and conservator of Sahyadri Tiger Reserve. Ladkat reportedly cycled 294 kilometres in 17 hours, of which 12 hours were spent pedalling. "The purpose behind this cycling endeavour was to give a message of saving forests," Ladkat said.

2.title: Railway Division in Pune earns record revenue from auto transport
2.article_body: The Railway Division in Pune earned record ₹54.51 crore by transporting vehicles from various automobile manufacturers in the district in the previous financial year. This is a 143% hike in revenues earned from the segment in comparison to the year before last, according to a report. The division had run 301 freight trains last year to transport the vehicles.

3.title: Over 10 illegal farmhouses along Yamuna floodplains demolished
3.article_body: Noida Authority on Friday demolished more than 10 farmhouses along the Yamuna floodplains in Sectors 134 and 135 that had been built illegally. "A drive was carried out to demolish the illegal structures. As per the rules, in floodplain areas, permanent structures cannot be maintained," an official said. The structures were spread across an area of over 25,000 square metres.

4.title: Kejriwal, Mann spin charkha at Guj's Sabarmati Ashram; video surfaces
4.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party has shared a video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann spinning the charkha at the Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat's Ahmedabad during their visit on Saturday on Twitter. Mahatma Gandhi had stayed in the Ashram. "We consider ourselves blessed that we were born in Gandhiji's country...There is a feeling of peace here," Kejriwal said.

5.title: Tamannaah celebrates Gudi Padwa on sets of 'Babli Bouncer', shares pics
5.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia celebrated Gudi Padwa on the sets of her upcoming film, 'Babli Bouncer'. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories on Saturday, shared a few pictures where she can be seen posing with the film's director Madhur Bhandarkar and actors Saurabh Shukla and Supriya Shukla. "Thank you Madhur sir for always adding festivities to our work days," Tamannaah wrote.

6.title: Bungalow of Hanuman set on fire: Tejashwi on Chirag's eviction from Janpath residence
6.article_body: Days after LJP leader Chirag Paswan was evicted from 12 Janpath bungalow which was allotted to Ram Vilas Paswan in New Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said that BJP has set fire to the bungalow of 'Hanuman'. "Ram Vilas Paswan was standing with the BJP till the last. This is the consequence of supporting the BJP," he added.

7.title: Andhra CM flags off 500 AC vans to transport pregnant women to hospitals
7.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday flagged off 500 air-conditioned (AC) vans, named Dr YSR Thalli Bidda Express, to transport pregnant women to hospitals for delivery for free. The vans will also drop the mother and newborn back home once they are discharged from the hospital. "108 ambulance services...104 healthcare services have also been revamped," Reddy said.

8.title: Maybe Umesh's hurt after being picked late having gone unsold twice: Kaif
8.article_body: Talking about Umesh Yadav who is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, Mohammad Kaif said Umesh may have felt hurt after being picked late in the mega auction, having gone unsold in the first two rounds. "Umesh may have felt that in the future no IPL team [will] go for him and that's...what may have motivated him," added Kaif.

9.title: Rohit batting with new approach since India's T20 WC loss vs NZ: Parthiv
9.article_body: Parthiv Patel said Team India captain Rohit Sharma has been batting with a new approach having adopted the role of an enforcer, since Team India's defeats against Pakistan and New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2021. "Rohit can accelerate really well but if he starts with an aggressive intent as well, the bowlers are taken aback," added Parthiv.

10.title: He said 'I took a punch from Muhammad Ali': Oscars Producer on Chris' reaction
10.article_body: Academy Awards Producer Will Packer has revealed what happened backstage after Will Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock. Packer recalled, "I said, 'Did he really hit you?' And he looked at me and he goes, 'I just took a punch from Muhammad Ali'...He was immediately in joke mode, but you could tell that he was very much still in shock."

11.title: China separates COVID-19 positive children from their parents in Shanghai
11.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai are separating COVID-19 infected children from their parents and sending them to quarantine centres, amid the city's largest outbreak. One such parent said doctors threatened to leave her infected two-and-a-half-year-old daughter at the hospital if the child wasn't sent to quarantine. Pictures of crying children at a Shanghai health facility went viral in China.

12.title: Who were India's 2011 World Cup-winning squad members and how did they perform?
12.article_body: India's 2011 World Cup-winning squad was led by MS Dhoni, who scored 241 runs in the tournament. Sachin Tendulkar, featuring in his last World Cup, was India's highest run-scorer with 482 runs. Zaheer Khan was India's highest wicket-taker in the tournament with 21 wickets. Yuvraj Singh, who was Player of the Tournament, scored 362 runs and took 15 wickets.

13.title: For ₹1,400 crore, Amazon destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company: Future Retail
13.article_body: Future Retail told the Supreme Court that "for ₹1,400 crore, Amazon has destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company". Future's lawyer was referring to the ₹1,400 crore deal between Amazon and Future Coupons, which Amazon has cited to block the deal between Future and Reliance Retail. "We are hanging by a thread...No one wants to do business with us now," Future's lawyer said.

14.title: Criminal probe ordered after UK ferry firm fired 786 employees on Zoom call
14.article_body: UK's P&O Ferries is under criminal and civil investigation after it fired 786 employees over a Zoom call without notice and replaced them with lower-paid crew. The company's CEO Peter Hebblethwaite "stood before MPs and admitted to breaking the law and his actions must now be scrutinised", UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said. Hebblethwaite said unions weren't consulted before layoffs.

15.title: BSF seizes 210 cough syrup bottles from Indo-B'desh border in Meghalaya
15.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) troops have seized 210 bottles of Phensedyl syrup from India-Bangladesh border in Meghalaya's South Garo hills. According to a statement, the bottles were being smuggled to Bangladesh, where the codeine-based cough syrup is banned. This year, BSF seized over 1,300 bottles of Phensedyl while they were being sent illegally through the international border in Meghalaya.

16.title: TV actors Dheeraj Dhoopar, Vinny Arora expecting their 1st child; share pic
16.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' actor Dheeraj Dhoopar and his wife, actress Vinny Arora took to social media to announce that they are expecting their first child. "We're expecting, a tiny miracle August 2022," they wrote in the caption. Several actors, including Kishwer Merchantt, Suyyash Rai and Avika Gor congratulated them in the comments section.

17.title: Congratulations, all the best: PM Modi to Aus ahead of Women's WC final
17.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has extended good wishes and congratulated Australia as they will be playing in Women's World Cup final against defending champions England on Sunday. Notably, six-time champions Australia are on an 11-match unbeaten streak. England and Australia will meet in a World Cup final for first time in 34 years. Match will be played at Hagley Oval, Christchurch.

18.title: Indian startup Pixxel launches its first satellite to space with Musk's SpaceX
18.article_body: Indian space tech startup Pixxel has launched its first satellite to space aboard billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Transporter-4 mission from Cape Canaveral, US. Called 'Shakuntala', it is the startup's first fully-fledged satellite and hosts one of the highest resolution hyperspectral commercial cameras ever flown to space, Pixxel said. The startup is aiming to build a health monitor for Earth.

19.title: SRK is an amazing actor, he's very passionate about his work: Bobby
19.article_body: Bobby Deol in an interview praised Shah Rukh Khan and his skills as a producer. He said that Shah Rukh is an amazing actor and very passionate about his work. "That's why he started his production house and...I'm so thankful for Red Chillies because they gave me 'Class of 83'...and that was the beginning of my OTT journey," said Bobby.

20.title: Miley Cyrus tests positive for COVID-19, says 'It was worth it'
20.article_body: Singer-actor Miley Cyrus, who was recently on a world tour, has tested positive for COVID-19. "Traveling around the world...meeting hundreds of fans a day...chances of getting Covid are pretty high. I have Covid now but it was definitely worth it," she wrote on Twitter. However, the singer added that she will not be performing at the upcoming Janie's Fund event.

21.title: Aaditya Thackeray inaugurates 'Alternate Fuel Conclave' in Pune
21.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday inaugurated the 'Alternate Fuel Conclave' in Pune. The conclave, which aims to promote clean mobility, will have an electric vehicle (EV) exhibition and an EV rally on April 3. Many companies, including Tata Motors, are participating in the exhibition to showcase their two-wheelers and cars from the alternate fuel segment.

22.title: Rashmika Mandanna to play female lead in Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Animal'
22.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna is set to play the female lead in Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Animal'. The makers of the film announced the decision on the occasion of Ugadi and Gudi Padwa on Saturday. Helmed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, the film will go on floors this summer. 'Animal' will also star Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol in key roles.

23.title: Don't lie, it's not: Arshad after reporter calls Bachchhan Paandey a 'success'
23.article_body: In a recent media interaction, actor Arshad Warsi spoke about the box office performance of his recently released film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. When a reporter called the film's performance at the box office "a success", Arshad chuckled and said, "Don't lie, it's not a success." Arshad added that it was a good film and it just went through a bad patch.

24.title: Thanks but we'll pass: Russia as Czech govt asks Russian diplomats to quit
24.article_body: Czech Republic's Foreign Ministry appealed to Russian diplomats to quit over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine to avoid being accomplices to the "apocalyptic destruction of its sovereign neighbour". Reacting to it, the Russian Mission in Geneva said, "Thanks for the 'generous offer'...but we'll pass. We've plenty of conscience and already maintain the capacity to recognize US lapdog when we see one."

25.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹4 cr of Punjab ex-SSP in money laundering case
25.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached assets worth ₹4.07 crore of Punjab Police's former Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Surjit Singh Grewal in a money laundering case. He had allegedly incurred excess expenditure above his known lawful sources of income. Grewal had purchased various immovable and movable properties in his and his family members' name, as per ED.

26.title: Forest officials rescue 3 kangaroos in West Bengal; team formed to investigate
26.article_body: Forest officials have rescued three kangaroos in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri. According to officials, at least two of the kangaroos were found with some critical injuries on their bodies and were sent to Bengal Safari park for treatment. "A team has been formed to investigate the matter," said Sanjay Dutta, the Belacoba forest range officer.

27.title: Meat shops ordered to remain shut during Navratri in Ghaziabad
27.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has directed all meat shops to remain shut from April 2-10 in view of Navratri. "It has been directed that cleanliness be maintained in respective zones, in temples, and to ensure meat shops remain closed," the order issued for five zones read. Mayor Asha Sharma said the ban on selling raw meat is enforced only during Navratri.

28.title: I've reached a stage where negativity motivates me: Shehnaaz Gill
28.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill in an interview has stated that she has reached a stage where even negativity motivates her to do better. "I believe in doing right, not hurting anyone and concentrating...on improving myself. Maybe that's what will determine my success in life," the actress added. She was earlier trolled for smiling after her boyfriend actor Sidharth Shukla's demise.

29.title: Kim Kardashian to rebrand 'KKW Fragrance' amid divorce with Kanye West
29.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian announced on Friday that she will be rebranding her 'KKW Fragrance' line. Kim took to her Instagram Stories to inform that the KKW Fragrance website will shut down on May 1 to 'relaunch in the future under a brand new name'. This comes after Kim was declared legally single by a US court.

30.title: 1st time feels like Northeast is part of India's mainstream: Rijiju
30.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju while addressing a conference over the reduction of areas under AFSPA in Manipur, Nagaland and Assam on Saturday, said that for the "first time" it feels like the Northeast is part of India's "mainstream". He also called the decision to withdraw AFSPA "revolutionary", and added that it means that "peace has returned to that area".

31.title: MI to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
31.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 match.  MI are fielding the same playing XI that featured in their defeat against DC. RR have made one change to their playing XI, with Navdeep Saini replacing Nathan Coulter-Nile. RR had won their opening match of IPL 2022 against SRH.

32.title: Nigerian held in Noida for cheating women through matrimony sites
32.article_body: A Nigerian national was arrested in UP's Noida for allegedly cheating women by contacting them through matrimonial sites using fake identities, police said. The accused who came to India on medical visa, has so far, as per Cyber Cell estimates, duped his victims of at least ₹50 crore. The police have also traced a farmhouse he has purchased near Pune.

33.title: Will fulfil commitments on crypto, bank privatisation: FM Sitharaman
33.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the government will fulfil commitments on issues like bank privatisation and cryptocurrency regulation. Speaking at the CNBC-TV18 India Business Leader Awards event, she added, "These are commitments which we have to fulfil. We will be moving forward, you will get to know when."

34.title: 26-yr-old woman returning from work gang-raped in park by 2 men in Delhi
34.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped and thrashed by two men while she was returning from work in Delhi on Tuesday night. The accused initially raped her inside a park and then took her to rented accommodation and perpetrated the crime again, a report stated. Following a complaint, Delhi Police arrested both the accused on charges of abduction and rape.

35.title: Next pandemic could be caused by insect-borne viruses like Zika, dengue: WHO
35.article_body: The next pandemic could be triggered by insect-borne viruses like Zika and dengue, an official of the World Health Organization (WHO) has warned. "We...have some signals that the risk is increasing," said Dr Sylvie Briand, Director of WHO's Global Infectious Hazard Preparedness team. Stressing on preparing for the potential pandemic, the agency said that international action is essential.

36.title: Delhi govt allows private shops to offer discounts up to 25% on liquor MRP
36.article_body: Delhi's Department of Excise has issued an order allowing the private shops in the city to offer discounts up to 25% on MRP of liquor. "However, in overall public interest...government reserves the right to withdraw the discount at any time," the order reads. Earlier, in February, the Delhi government had prohibited discounts and schemes being offered by liquor stores.

37.title: PBKS showed real fight to reduce KKR to 51/4 after scoring 137: Mayank
37.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said his team's bowlers showed "real fight" to reduce KKR to 51/4, while defending 138 in their IPL 2022 match. Andre Russell, Sam Billings stitched an unbeaten partnership of 90 runs off 47 balls as KKR won by six wickets. Russell scored 70 runs off 31 balls with the knock comprising two fours, eight sixes.

38.title: Don't just think of scoring 200, need to respect the pitch: Kaif on PBKS
38.article_body: Reacting to PBKS being bowled out for 137 in their IPL 2022 match against KKR, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said PBKS need to respect the pitch rather than just thinking of scoring 200 every time. "The fact that Bhanuka Rajapaksa would hit three sixes off three balls and would be so explosive is something...I didn't quite read," added Kaif.

39.title: Experience of winning 2017 Women's World Cup can help us: England captain
39.article_body: England skipper Heather Knight said the team's experience of winning ICC Women's World Cup in 2017 can help her side win the 2022 Women's World Cup final against Australia on Sunday. "It (winning 2017 World Cup) will be really useful for us...knowing that we can deal with that pressure when games are close and things are at stake," said Knight.

40.title: Mumbai taxi driver cheated of ₹38 lakh he arranged by selling brother's home
40.article_body: A taxi driver from Kurla, Irshad Shaikh, was allegedly cheated of ₹38 lakh by a woman, Komal Paranjpe, and her accomplice, Anil Vishnu Sawant. Sawant claimed he needed money to transfer a wine shop licence to his name and assured Shaikh he'd give him ₹50 lakh for the help. Shaikh sold his brother's house and mortgaged ornaments to arrange money.

41.title: JP Morgan drops Apple, Qualcomm from most preferred stocks list
41.article_body: Analysts at JP Morgan have dropped Apple and chipmaker Qualcomm from its list of most preferred stocks over slowing smartphones demand. The firm still rates Apple and Qualcomm "overweight", the equivalent of a "buy" rating. It was earlier reported that Apple is planning to cut the production of iPhone and AirPod due to a demand slowdown.

42.title: New variant of COVID-19 found in UK, WHO issues warning
42.article_body: A new COVID-19 variant has been found in the UK, with the country's Health Security Agency saying it was studying 'XE' - a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, referred to as a "recombinant". The WHO has issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of Omicron, that may be more transmissible than any strain of COVID-19.

43.title: I feared for my life a couple of times while batting with Russell: KKR's Sam Billings
43.article_body: Talking about Andre Russell's match-winning knock of 70*(31) against PBKS, KKR's Sam Billings said, "I had the best seat in the house and, what a performance by the big man." He added, "I was very lucky to be standing where I stood. I feared for my life a couple of times, as we saw, but special, special [knock] for him."

44.title: Video shows 2 drunk men dancing on car roof in Ghaziabad, car owner fined ₹20,000
44.article_body: Ghaziabad Police has fined a car owner ₹20,000 after a video showed two men, who were allegedly drunk, dancing on its roof. "A group of boys, visibly drunk, dancing on the roof of their car on the Delhi-Meerut expressway," a Twitter user wrote. The video shows one of them recording a video of the two men dancing on the roof.

45.title: Kolkata-bound IndiGo flight develops technical snag while taking off, grounded
45.article_body: A Kolkata-bound IndiGo flight was grounded at Ranchi Airport in Jharkhand on Saturday after it developed a technical snag while taking off, officials said. "The air-conditioner of the plane developed a snag and it stopped working," said Vinod Sharma, the airport's director. According to him, alternative arrangements were made for the passengers and the flight was brought back to bay.

46.title: Serbian President waves at imaginary crowd at an event, video surfaces
46.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic waving at an imaginary crowd along with Hungarian PM Viktor Orban after Vucic inaugurated a section of a railway line. The clip showed Vucic waving at the railway platform, which had no crowd, while Orban is seated next to him. Orban, however, stopped waving after a point.

47.title: Future Enterprises misses due date to repay ₹2,835 crore to lenders
47.article_body: Future Enterprises has informed the stock exchanges that it has missed the due date of March 31, 2022, to repay ₹2,835.65 crore to various consortium banks and lenders. On Friday, Future Retail (FRL) said it had defaulted on a loan repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore and also failed to raise ₹3,900 crore. FRL cited ongoing litigations with Amazon as the reason.

48.title: US commits $300 million more in security aid to Ukraine
48.article_body: The US has said it will provide an additional $300 million in security assistance to bolster Ukraine's capacity to defend itself. The package includes laser-guided rocket systems, tactical drones, Humvees, night vision goggles, machine guns, and medical supplies. "The US has now committed...over $1.6 billion in security assistance since Russia's unprovoked, premeditated invasion," Pentagon said.

49.title: Heat wave warning issued for 10 states/UTs over 5 days, list released
49.article_body: The IMD issued heat wave warning for 10 states/UTs over five days. Heat wave conditions are likely to prevail over Haryana and Chhattisgarh on April 2. They are likely to prevail over Himachal Pradesh, Jammu, Maharashtra and Gujarat on April 2 and 3. Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh & Madhya Pradesh may witness heat wave conditions during next five days.

50.title: PM 'robbing' Punjab of its rights: CM Bhagwant Mann
50.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann accused PM Narendra Modi of "robbing" the state of its rights amid a political row over Home Minister Amit Shah's recent announcement that central service rules will apply to employees of Chandigarh. "The PM says 'sabka saath sabka vikas'. Where is our 'saath'? Neither you take our 'saath' nor give the same to us," Mann said.

51.title: Australia trade pact is India's 1st agreement with a developed country after 10 yrs
51.article_body: After India signed an economic cooperation and trade agreement with Australia, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal referred to it as a "historic day" for India. "It is the first agreement with a developed country after a decade," Goyal said. The agreement will take bilateral trade from the existing $27.5 billion to $45-50 billion in over five years, the minister added.

52.title: Which sectors will benefit from India's historic trade pact with Australia?
52.article_body: Several labour-intensive sectors will get duty-free access to markets in Australia under the historic economic cooperation and trade agreement signed by India and Australia. These include textiles and apparel, leather and footwear, select agricultural and fish products, gems and jewellery, pharma and machinery and electrical goods sectors. Overall, 96% of Indian goods will get duty-free access.

53.title: 25 Rohingyas owing allegiance to Tablighi Jamaat detained in J&K
53.article_body: At least 25 Rohingya men who owe allegiance to the Tablighi Jamaat have been detained by the police in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, officials said. The Rohingyas were later shifted to a holding centre inside a jail in Hiranagar on Friday, the officials added. The men had been picked up from two mosques in Ramban on March 30, police said.

54.title: Open borders between India, Nepal should not be misused: PM Modi
54.article_body: The open borders between India and Nepal should not be misused, PM Narendra Modi said on Saturday at an event in Delhi. Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba, who is on a visit to India, was also present at the event. "We also stressed on maintaining close cooperation between our defence and security agencies," PM Modi added.

55.title: BharatPe board aiming for IPO in 18-24 months: Chairman
55.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said the firm's board, founders and management want to take it public in the next 18-24 months. He added the board will also be expanded with more independent directors in future. He also revealed that there have been investor queries for funding and despite the negative press, BharatPe's valuation should be higher than $2.8 billion.

56.title: Waiting to book case if you're wheeling: B'luru police as it arrests person
56.article_body: Bengaluru's DCP Traffic East on Friday tweeted that it has filed a case against a person and seized his two-wheeler for allegedly wheeling on Bettadasanapura Road in Electronic City. "If you are wheeling, we are waiting to book [a] case against you," the traffic police said. The traffic police also shared a picture of the accused and the seized vehicle.

57.title: Lady Gaga, Justin Bieber to perform at Grammys 2022
57.article_body: Lady Gaga and Justin Bieber will perform at the 64th Grammy Awards in Las Vegas on April 3. The announcement of Gaga and Bieber's performances comes after the rock band Foo Fighters cancelled their performance at the Grammys this year following the demise of their drummer Taylor Hawkins. Gaga and Bieber join a lineup that includes BTS and Billie Eilish.

58.title: Oil depot attack to further stretch Russian logistics: UK
58.article_body: The destruction of several oil tanks at a depot in Russia's Belgorod city will "likely add short-term strain to Russia's already stretched logistics chains", UK Defence Ministry said. Russia had accused Ukraine of carrying out the airstrike at the oil depot on Friday. "Supplies to Russian forces encircling [Ukraine's] Kharkiv [60 km from Belgorod] may be particularly affected," it added.

59.title: Entire India will be happy seeing Hardik Pandya bowl 4 overs: Shastri
59.article_body: Ravi Shastri said entire India will be happy seeing Hardik Pandya bowl four overs, adding that India will straightaway become potential T20 World Cup 2022 winners if Hardik finds his mojo. "Hardik is hungry," stated Shastri. Discussing the IPL 2022 match between MI and RR, Shastri said Jos Buttler will "hammer" the MI bowlers if he survives for six overs.

60.title: Political executive will change, you are permanent: CJI Ramana to CBI
60.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that political executive will change with time but the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), as an institution, is permanent. "Be impermeable...be independent," CJI told CBI. "There is an immediate requirement for the creation of an independent umbrella institution...to bring various agencies like CBI, SFIO, ED, etc under one roof," he stated.

61.title: Anil wishes sister-in-law & Miss India 1969 Kavita Singh on b'day, pens note
61.article_body: Anil Kapoor took to Instagram on Friday to wish his sister-in-law Kavita Singh on her 70th birthday. Kavita is Sunita Kapoor's elder sister and was crowned Miss India in 1969. Sharing some old pictures of Kavita, Anil wrote, "Happy 70th Birthday Kavita! We're all so proud of you always! Lucky to have a friend and sister in law like you."

62.title: SAI releases over ₹7 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes
62.article_body: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has released ₹7.22 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes across 21 disciplines, including para-sports, for the months of January to March. The amount includes an out-of-pocket allowance of ₹1.20 lakh for each residential athlete. The majority part of the budget is allocated for athletes' lodging, food and education at the academy, SAI said.

63.title: 40,000 tonnes of diesel from India reach Sri Lanka as it declares emergency
63.article_body: A ship carrying 40,000 tonnes of diesel under a $1-billion credit line by India has reached Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis. On Friday night, the country's government declared a state of emergency after protests over the crisis turned violent. Earlier, Indian Oil's Lankan subsidiary supplied 6,000 MT of fuel to the Ceylon Electricity Board to generate electricity.

64.title: Ukraine raises $600,000 from 'Museum of War' NFTs on Russian invasion
64.article_body: The Ukrainian government has raised more than $600,000 from its NFT collection, Meta History: Museum of War', showing a timeline of the Russian invasion. The government sold 1,282 artworks on its first day of sales, raising 190 Ether cryptocurrency tokens. The Ukrainian government has already raised about $70.2 million in crypto donations, its official website showed.

65.title: Woman techie arrested for selling cannabis to IT employees, youths in Hyd
65.article_body: A woman techie was arrested for allegedly supplying cannabis to some IT employees and youths in Hyderabad. Police said she, along with her husband and two others, were selling cannabis to customers on March 12 when police apprehended two youths with 1.2 kg cannabis. The couple, who had managed to escape, were arrested after police received information from the youths.

66.title: I suffered from sleep apnea, it got more intense with time and it is dangerous: Badshah
66.article_body: Rapper Badshah, in an episode of Shilpa Shetty's fitness chat show 'Shape of You', revealed that he suffered from sleep apnea. "It got more intense with time and it is dangerous," he added, stating that now he doesn't suffer from it. "I have been through clinical depression, I have been through severe anxiety disorder," he further said.

67.title: I don't discuss my orders: Zelenskyy on Russian allegations of fuel depot attack
67.article_body: Responding to Russian accusations that Ukraine attacked a fuel depot inside Russia's Belgorod, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "I'm sorry I don't discuss any of my orders." "There are things which I only share with military armed forces of Ukraine," Zelenskyy added. Russian Ministry of Defense stated that two Ukrainian Mi-24 helicopters carried out an airstrike on the depot.

68.title: SRH lodge protest against Kane Williamson's dismissal
68.article_body: SRH have lodged a protest with the BCCI against their captain Kane Williamson's dismissal against RR in their first IPL 2022 match, claiming that the catch was not clean. RR's Devdutt Padikkal had managed to scoop his fingers under the ball to hold onto a low catch and the third umpire had ruled that the catch was clean.

69.title: I need to work hard on my game: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav
69.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' fast bowler Umesh Yadav believes that he needs to "work hard" on his skills despite picking up four wickets against the Punjab Kings on Friday. "I need to work hard. Getting older and when you know you play just one format, I look to bowl as much as possible," Yadav said.

70.title: Lemon price rises to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat due to tight supply
70.article_body: The prices of lemons have surged to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat's Rajkot due to a shortage in supplies and a rise in demand. Earlier, the lemons were being sold at ₹50-60 per kg, as per ANI report. "This increase in price is affecting our kitchen budget. We don't know when will the prices go down," a customer told ANI.

71.title: Russian forces are noticeably moving out of northern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
71.article_body: Russian troops are "slowly but noticeably" moving out of the north of Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. He urged residents to remain cautious amid troop withdrawal. Zelenskyy also warned that the situation in the country's east is "extremely difficult" with Russia gathering its forces and "preparing for new powerful blows". Ukraine is preparing an "active" defence, he added.

72.title: Exempt Ayodhya temples from water, house tax: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
72.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday asked Ayodhya Municipal Corporation to stop the collection of house and water taxes from temples, maths and dharamshalas. He instead suggested  taking 'token money' from such religious institutions. "He asked officials to prepare a plan in this regard and submit it to the urban development department," a government spokesperson added.

73.title: Too much pressure on Pollard, even the opponents know that: Shastri
73.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said there is "too much" pressure on MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard in the absence of Hardik Pandya, Krunal Pandya and Suryakumar Yadav. "Even the opponents know that Pollard is under pressure. His early wicket can make a difference of 20-30 runs," added Shastri. Pollard was dismissed for three in MI's IPL 2022 opener against DC.

74.title: Police seize truck carrying 197 kg of marijuana in Pune, 3 booked
74.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad police have seized 197 kilograms of marijuana from a truck in Pune and have booked three people including the driver who has been arrested. Police intercepted the truck on the Chakan–Shikrapur road and seized items worth ₹63.34 lakh, police said. The case was lodged under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

75.title: Hyd SHE Teams in-charge reviews performance for first quarter of 2022
75.article_body: AR Srinivas, Additional Commissioner of Police (Crimes), on Friday reviewed the performance of Hyderabad SHE Teams for the first quarter of the year 2022. Srinivas, who is also in-charge of SHE Teams, rewarded officials for their sustained efforts in making Hyderabad a safe city for women. He further promised to provide the teams with more advanced logistics in future.

76.title: Pune court to fine woman each time father is denied access to son
76.article_body: A family court in Pune has directed a woman to allow the father access to their 11-year-old son or she will be fined ₹5,000 for each missed access. The court said that if the woman violates the order in the next six months, the son's custody will be given to the father. The couple has been living separately since 2008.

77.title: Punjab govt is 'baccha party': Anil Vij on Punjab seeking transfer of Chandigarh
77.article_body: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana Minister Anil Vij, said, "Punjab government is 'baccha party'. They don't have complete knowledge of issues." "Chandigarh isn't the only issue but there are many other issues linked to it," he added. "They didn't speak anything about issues like SYL, Hindi speaking areas," he added.

78.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 10 accused, rejects pleas of 8 in Palghar lynching case
78.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to 10 accused and rejected the pleas of eight others in connection with 2020 Palghar mob lynching case. The applicants cannot be held guilty without any sufficient evidence, HC said. A mob lynched two sadhus and their driver in April 2020 in Maharashtra's Palghar amid rumours that thieves were roaming around during COVID-19 lockdown.

79.title: Trust yourself when no one does: Amit Mishra on Umesh holding Purple Cap
79.article_body: Reacting to Umesh Yadav being IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "Trust yourself even when no one else does." Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches at an economy rate of 4.91. "Umesh played...two matches in [the] last two IPL seasons...Warms my heart to see him do well," read a tweet from Wasim Jaffer.

80.title: Teacher gets 5-year jail term for sexually abusing 13-year-old boy in Mumbai
80.article_body: A 52-year-old sports teacher was convicted and sentenced to five years in jail for sexually abusing a 13-year-old boy on the pretext of giving him a medal and a certificate for participating in a competition. The boy informed a court in Mumbai that the accused pretended to show him and his friend a magic trick and then touched him inappropriately.

81.title: BMC's property tax collection increases by ₹700 crore in 2021-22
81.article_body: The property tax collected by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) increased by ₹700 crore in 2021-22 as compared to the last year. The BMC collected ₹5,792 crore from property tax in 2021-22, which is the highest in its history, officials added. According to the civic body, three out of the city's 24 wards collected 30% more tax than the previous year.

82.title: Langur cutouts to be placed in parts of UP's Meerut to scare away monkeys
82.article_body: The Forest Department in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has decided to place cutouts of langurs in some areas to scare away monkeys. "Increasing monkey presence is a concern in northern India," Meerut DFO said, adding that the move is aimed at providing relief to people. Residents had earlier reportedly appealed to the district administration to find a solution to the problem.

83.title: Biden nominates 2 Indian-Americans to key administrative positions
83.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated two Indian-Americans to key administrative positions. Vinay Singh has been nominated as Chief Financial Officer, Department of Housing and Urban Development, while Kalpana Kotagal is the nominee for Commissioner on the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission. Singh had also served in the Obama-Biden administration as a Deputy Assistant Secretary (US Field).

84.title: Class 10 girl beaten for hours for filing rape complaint in Odisha
84.article_body: Eight people, including five women, have been arrested for allegedly beating a Class 10 girl for hours at a kangaroo court in Odisha's Nayagarh for filing a case accusing a 21-year-old man of raping her. The girl's family claimed that they were advised to not file a case earlier. The girl was also tied to an electric pole, police said.

85.title: My PAN card misused, small loan of ₹2,500 taken on my name: Rajkummar Rao calls out fraud
85.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao took to Twitter to call out fraud, claiming that his PAN card was misused and a small loan of ₹2,500 was taken on his name. He added that his CIBIL score has been affected due to it. He further wrote, "@CIBIL_Official, please rectify the same and do take precautionary steps against this."

86.title: Irfan Pathan pranks Suresh Raina on live TV over Preity Zinta comment
86.article_body: Irfan Pathan pranked Suresh Raina on April Fool's Day during pre-IPL match show. Irfan was talking about PBKS when Raina remarked, "Irfan...played for PBKS...for three years...Preity Zinta is their owner." Seemingly angry, Irfan said, "This isn't right...The way you brought in female angle" and left the frame. Irfan revealed it was a prank when Raina went to bring him back.

87.title: BharatPe has appointed Alvarez & Marsal exec as interim CFO: Chairman
87.article_body: BharatPe has appointed an executive from Alvarez & Marsal as its interim CFO, Chairman Rajnish Kumar said. The firm is in search of a permanent CFO and Kumar said it is in the "advanced stages" to appoint one. Kumar added that the board, founders, and management are exploring taking the firm public in the next 18-24 months.

88.title: Twitter tweets 'we're working on an edit button'; users say it's April Fools' Day
88.article_body: On April 1, Twitter tweeted on its official account that it was "working on an edit button" after which several users flagged that it was April Fools' Day. When asked if the tweet was a joke, Twitter told Reuters, "We cannot confirm or deny but we may edit our statement later." "Prove it by editing this tweet," a user wrote.

89.title: 'Stop bullying India' poster found outside US Embassy in Delhi; FIR registered
89.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against an unknown person after a poster asking US to "stop bullying India" was found stuck on a board outside the US Embassy. "Reliable [US President] Biden administration, stop bullying India. We don't need you. US needs India against China," the poster read. Police is making use of technical surveillance to trace the person.

90.title: Chandigarh is and will remain joint capital of Punjab, Haryana: CM Khattar
90.article_body: After Punjab government's resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said Chandigarh is the joint capital of the two states and will remain so. "Punjab government's one-sided resolution has no meaning," he added. "This isn't only a subject of Punjab but also of Haryana. Even the people of Himachal Pradesh claim their share," Khattar said.

91.title: 3 arrested for shooting at sarpanch over business rivalry in Gurugram
91.article_body: Three men were arrested for their alleged involvement in the shooting of a 50-year-old sarpanch in Gurugram's Babupur over business rivalry, police said. The main accused had taken a loan of ₹10 lakh from the sarpanch's nephew, police added. On being asked to return the loan, the accused demanded a share in the nephew's water supply and construction business.

92.title: 'Pulp Fiction' stars Samuel, Uma Thurman to reunite for 'The Kill Room'
92.article_body: Samuel L. Jackson and Uma Thurman, who shared screen space in 'Pulp Fiction', are teaming up again for a new comic crime thriller titled 'The Kill Room'. According to The Hollywood Reporter, it'll be directed by Nicol Paone, who helmed the comedy-drama 'Friendsgiving'. "Getting to make 'The Kill Room' with Uma and Samuel is beyond my wildest dreams," Paone said.

93.title: Performance of Lalit, Axar has given DC a huge boost: Ajit Agarkar
93.article_body: Delhi Capitals' assistant coach Ajit Agarkar has acknowledged that their IPL franchise got a "huge boost" from Lalit Yadav and Axar Patel's match-winning partnership against Mumbai Indians last week. "When you win from difficult situations, it always gives you... much more confidence as a team," Agarkar said. He also added that DC have a great depth in its batting order.

94.title: China denies deliberately circumventing Russia sanctions
94.article_body: China said it's not deliberately circumventing sanctions on Russia, a day after EU leaders warned Beijing against doing so. Wang Lutong, a Chinese Foreign Ministry official, said Beijing was helping the global economy through continued trade with Russia. "China is not a related party to Ukraine crisis. We don't think our normal trade with any...country should be affected," Lutong said.

95.title: BJP MP demands renaming UP's Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar, writes to CM
95.article_body: BJP MP from Farrukhabad, Mukesh Rajput, has written to UP CM Yogi Adityanath demanding renaming Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar. “Farrukhabad has links to the Mahabharata era. The capital of king Drupada used to be here... known as Panchala area,” he wrote. However, Rajput denied the request being based on religious lines and claimed it's to only "revive ancient Indian culture".

96.title: Uber raises cab fares by 15% in Mumbai as fuel prices go up
96.article_body: App-based taxi firm Uber has raised fares by 15% for travel in Mumbai to offset the impact of rising fuel prices, the company said. Fuel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days across the country on Saturday. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre while diesel price has increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.

97.title: Matua community pilgrims claim their bus attacked in Bengal, block rail track
97.article_body: Some members of the Matua community blocked the track at Habra railway station in protest against an alleged attack on a bus carrying the pilgrims to 'Baruni Mela' in West Bengal. Four persons have been arrested in the incident so far. Police claimed the pilgrims got into an altercation with another bus' passengers following a collision between the two vehicles.

98.title: IIT-Delhi gifted indoor sports complex by alumnus Saurabh Mittal
98.article_body: IIT-Delhi inaugurated its three-storey air-conditioned indoor sports complex on Friday. The complex will be called the ‘Mittal Sports Complex’ since it has been installed due to the financial aid of ₹10 crore given by the institute's alumnus and co-founder of the Indiabulls group Saurabh Mittal. The complex has several facilities including badminton courts, squash courts and a conference room.

99.title: Microsoft hires ex-Seattle police chief as global security risk ops exec
99.article_body: Microsoft has hired former Seattle police chief Carmen Best as Director of global security risk operations. Best became the first Black woman to serve as chief in 2018 but left in 2020. She will be in charge of Microsoft's global virtual security operations team, intelligence, executive threat intel, special asset security and event security, among other things.

100.title: UP Police raids BSP leader Haji Yakoob Qureshi's meat factory in Meerut
100.article_body: UP Police raided a meat factory in Meerut owned by BSP leader and former minister, Haji Yakoob Qureshi, officials said. "A case has been registered against 14 people...10 of them have been arrested. We found that it was running illegally," Meerut SSP Prabhakar Chaudhary said. "Action will be taken against the culprits under the Gangster Act," he added.

101.title: Neighbours allegedly beat Muslim man for putting up BJP flag in UP
101.article_body: A case has been filed after a Muslim man from Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur alleged that his neighbours thrashed him for putting up a BJP flag at his house. The man claimed that his neighbours were angered after a BJP MLA had come there and garlanded him. Earlier, a Muslim man was allegedly killed for celebrating BJP's win in state polls.

102.title: 3 criminals killed in police encounter in Assam's Goalpara
102.article_body: Three criminals were allegedly killed in police encounter while trying to escape in a truck in Assam's Goalpara district on Friday. "Acting on a tip-off, we stopped a vehicle but they tried to run away and opened fire on us," ASP Mrinal Deka said. The criminals were badly injured in the incident and were declared dead at hospital, he added.

103.title: No fine to be imposed for not wearing face masks in Delhi
103.article_body: In view of the declining COVID-19 positivity rate, the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) announced on Friday that the fine imposed for not wearing masks in public places will now be scrapped. An order issued by the DDMA, however, advised people to continue wearing masks in public places in order to avoid contracting COVID-19.

104.title: Doctors wanted to amputate my leg after I smashed my knee during 'Force 2': John
104.article_body: Actor John Abraham has revealed that doctors wanted to amputate his leg after he smashed his knee during 'Force 2'. "I underwent three surgeries. I had gangrene in my right leg and the doctors wanted to amputate my leg," he said. He added that his surgeon Dr Rajesh Maniar from Mumbai saved his knee.

105.title: 3 journalists among 34 arrested over Uttar Pradesh Board question paper leak
105.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police on Friday arrested 10 more people, including three journalists and parents and guardians of students, in connection with the leak of Class 12 UP Board English paper in Ballia. So far, 34 persons have been arrested in the case. At least two of the journalists have alleged that they've been framed for reporting on the paper leak.

106.title: Umesh was among the last to get picked, now most effective: Ajay Jadeja
106.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder Umesh Yadav was among the last players to get picked in mega auction, but is now the most effective. "Many players in the IPL end up getting typecast," added Ajay. Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches so far, after recording figures of 4/23 against PBKS.

107.title: Anyone can be a mystery bowler by bowling the perfect length: Rashid
107.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan said anyone can become a mystery bowler by bowling the deliveries at the perfect length time and again. "If you have good control over your skills, the element of mystery doesn't matter," added Rashid. "My length...makes me different from other leg-spinners," stated Rashid. "I am a spin-fast bowler because of [my] pace," said Rashid.

108.title: PM Modi greets people on Hindu New Year, Chaitra Navaratri
108.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday greeted people on the beginning of Hindu New Year, Chaitra Navaratri, and offered his best wishes to various regions and communities celebrating their new year as per the traditional Hindu calendar. "Happy New Year to all of you. May Vikram Samvat 2079 bring new enthusiasm and new zeal in everyone’s life," PM Modi tweeted.

109.title: India & Australia sign trade pact, 96% Indian goods to get duty free access
109.article_body: India and Australia on Saturday signed the Economic Cooperation & Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. Under the pact, over 96% Indian goods will get duty free access to Australia's market. "This is truly a watershed moment," PM Narendra Modi said. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the agreement will take bilateral trade to $45-50 billion in the next five years.

110.title: Rishi Kapoor was not happy with the 2nd half of 'Sharmaji...': Director
110.article_body: Hitesh Bhatia, director of Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', has revealed that Rishi was not "very happy" with the second half of the film. "He...had a lot of input. He kept calling us after every three-four days, with ideas to discuss," he added. "It took us another two or three months to finish...draft...So he was quite involved," said Hitesh.

111.title: Delhi shuts 1,000 jab centres, terminates services of vaccinators
111.article_body: The Delhi government has shut over 1,000 jab centres that were operational in schools, non-health facilities as majority of its adult, teenage population have received their first dose of COVID vaccination. The services of around 1,900 contractual vaccinators, nurses and data-entry operators were also terminated. On Friday, Delhi conducted its vaccination drive only from 488 centres, data showed.

112.title: B'luru petrol prices reach ₹108.14/litre after 10th hike in 12 days
112.article_body: After fuel prices were hiked for the 10th time in 12 days, the price of petrol has reached ₹108.14/litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹92.05/litre, according to the Indian Express. In total, the price of petrol has gone up by ₹7.20/litre. Earlier, Karnataka Congress leaders had staged a protest against the hike in fuel prices in Bengaluru.

113.title: Mid-day meal scheme to be renamed after Dr Shivakumara Swamiji: K'taka CM
113.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday announced that the mid-day meal scheme in the state will be renamed after Dr Shivakumara Swamiji of Siddaganga Mutt in the Tumakuru district. The announcement came on the occasion of Swamiji's 115th birth anniversary. BJP's state vice-president and son of former CM BS Yediyurappa, BY Vijayendra had earlier proposed to rename the scheme.

114.title: KKR were stunned by PBKS' approach after losing wicket in 1st over: Shreyas
114.article_body: Discussing KKR's win in the IPL 2022 match against PBKS, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer admitted his team was stunned by PBKS' approach after losing a wicket in the first over. Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Shikhar Dhawan stitched a partnership of 41 runs off 17 balls, after the dismissal of Mayank Agarwal for 1. PBKS finished the powerplay on 62/3.

115.title: Taiwan shuts 39 schools amid rising COVID-19 cases
115.article_body: Taiwan on Friday shut 39 schools in 10 counties amid rising COVID-19 cases. Reportedly, many teachers and students have been infected with the virus. According to the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), Taiwan on Friday reported 104 domestic COVID-19 cases, most in 281 days. So far, Taiwan has reported more than 23,620 COVID-19 cases and over 850 coronavirus-related deaths.

116.title: Indian Post launches Maha's 1st e-vehicles batch for home delivery
116.article_body: The Pune office of the Indian Post on Friday launched Maharashtra's first batch of e-vehicles for doorstep parcel delivery. "If the pilot proves to be successful, we'll look at extending it to many other post offices in the city," Pune Region Post Master General G Madhumita Das said. She added that the initiative is for "leveraging the consequential environmental benefits".

117.title: Pant can overcome IPL strike rate issue in a single innings: Shastri
117.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who has recorded strike rates of 128.52 and 113.95 in the previous two editions of IPL, Ravi Shastri said Pant can overcome the issue over his strike rate in a single innings. "The thing I like about Pant the most is that his batting...captaincy isn't the same. As a captain, he's...a lot more composed," added Shastri.

118.title: When Bezos was in space, we were getting signs to unionise: Ex-Amazon worker
118.article_body:
Former Amazon worker Christian Smalls said he would like to thank Jeff Bezos for going to space, after the Amazon workers at the New York warehouse voted to form Amazon's first US union.
"When he was up there we were signing people up. We were out here getting signatures," Smalls said. Bezos went to space in July last year.

119.title: Tharoor moves Private Member's Bill to repeal UAPA, calls Act a 'tool of abuse'
119.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor came up with a Private Member’s Bill to repeal the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act in Lok Sabha on Friday. "It’s (UAPA) a tool of abuse in which 66% of cases involve no violence, 56% are detained w/no charge-sheet for two years & conviction rate since 2014 is an abysmal 2.4%," Tharoor said in a tweet.

120.title: Video of Carrey forcibly kissing Alicia resurfaces after his comment on Will Smith
120.article_body: A video of actor-comedian Jim Carrey forcibly kissing actress Alicia Silverstone on stage at an award ceremony in 1997 resurfaced after his comments on Will Smith-Chris Rock slap controversy. Carrey criticised Will Smith, saying he would've sued him for $200 million. "After seeing...clip of Carrey assaulting Silverstone, it was best if he had kept his mouth shut," a user tweeted.

121.title: India records its warmest March in 122 years
121.article_body: India, on average, recorded its warmest March days in 122 years with the maximum temperature across the country clocking in at 1.86°C above normal, an analysis by the India Meteorological Department (IMD) showed. The average maximum, minimum and mean temperatures for the country as a whole during March 2022 were 33.10°C, 20.24°C and 26.67°C, respectively.

122.title: Petrol gets costlier by ₹7.20 per litre with 10 hikes in 12 days
122.article_body: Petrol and diesel have become costlier by ₹7.20 per litre each as the prices have been hiked 10 times since a four-and-half-month long pause in rate revision ended on March 22. Petrol price neared ₹103 per litre in Delhi on Saturday and crossed ₹117 in Mumbai after a hike of over 80 paise. Diesel price hit ₹93.87/litre in Delhi.

123.title: Man jailed for threatening to behead US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi
123.article_body: A 60-year-old man has been sentenced to 18 months in prison for making death threats to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and Illinois prosecutor Kim Foxx. Paul Vernon Hoeffer had pleaded guilty in January to threatening to cut Pelosi's head off "jihadist style" and calling Ocasio-Cortez's office to tell her he would "rip her head off".

124.title: Mike Tyson completes dubbing for Deverakonda's 'Liger', says 'I'm grateful'
124.article_body: Former American boxer Mike Tyson has finished dubbing for the pan-India movie 'Liger', which features Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday in the lead roles. Dharma Productions, taking to Instagram on Friday, shared the news along with a video message from Tyson. "Thank you very much for being kind to me. I'm very grateful," he said. It's directed by Puri Jagannadh.

125.title: I'd love to but industry lacks unity: John on working in all-star action film
125.article_body: Actor John Abraham said in an interview that he would love to do an all-star action film, adding, "But I think as an industry where we lack is unity." "That's something you've got to learn from the South. They are cohesive, and that's fantastic," he added. John will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns', which also stars Arjun Kapoor.

126.title: Bihar electricity dept staffer rides horse to work amid fuel price hike
126.article_body: A Bihar electricity department staffer from Sheohar has been riding a horse from one village to another to collect electricity bills amid a rise in fuel prices. The staffer claimed that he was spending nearly ₹200/day on petrol to collect the bills using his motorcycle. Petrol and diesel prices were increased for the 10th time in 12 days on Saturday.

127.title: Habitual house burglar held in Hyd, valuables worth ₹1.3 cr recovered
127.article_body: A 50-year-old habitual house burglar was arrested by Vanasthalipuram police in Hyderabad on Friday. Police also recovered valuables worth ₹1.3 crore, including 230 tolas of gold, 10 kg silver and over ₹15,000 cash, from the accused. According to police, the accused, identified as Muchu Ambedkar, lives near Indira Park. He has been committing burglaries for past 30 years, police added.

128.title: Pay farmers within 72 hours of crop procurement: UP CM to officials
128.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday directed officials to pay the farmers within 72 hours of crop procurement. "Officers should make all the necessary arrangements for the procurement of wheat in their respective districts so that farmers don't face any problem," Adityanath said. Notably, the Centre has fixed the minimum support price (MSP) of wheat at ₹2,015 per quintal.

129.title: Police lathicharge villagers protesting mining project in Chhattisgarh, 25 injured
129.article_body: A clash broke out between police and local residents after the latter tried to enter the collector's office to submit a 20-point memorandum over the Rowghat iron ore mining project in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur. Protesters claimed that 25 people were injured after police lathicharged them. According to the villagers, mining will destroy minor forest produce, which is their source of livelihood.

130.title: BMC medical officer duped of ₹1.75 lakh after investing in crypto based app
130.article_body: A 25-year-old BMC medical officer was cheated of ₹1.75 lakh after she invested in a cryptocurrency based app. According to police, the woman, who had learnt about the app from a relative, initially received returns on her investment after which she invested larger sums. However, she stopped receiving payment in the past few weeks following which she contacted the police.

131.title: Class 10 student jumps to death over sexual harassment by headmaster in Odisha
131.article_body: A Class 10 girl student jumped to death from the roof of a hostel building over alleged sexual harassment by the school's headmaster in Odisha's Sundargarh, police said. The headmaster and school's warden were detained on Friday, police added. Several other students also alleged sexual harassment by the headmaster, the police officials, who spoke to other girls, said.

132.title: Truck driver kills self for ₹30,000 in Bengaluru
132.article_body: A 35-year-old truck driver, identified as Kiran Kumar, killed himself in Bengaluru's Sanjeevini Nagar after allegedly not receiving his salary from private logistics firm he used to work for. Kumar had sent a video to three of his colleagues demanding ₹30,000 to be paid to him within 30 minutes and warned of ending his life if he was not paid.

133.title: Lawsuit against Airbnb over host spying on couple goes to arbitrator
133.article_body: A US judge has said that the lawsuit brought against Airbnb by a couple, that was allegedly videotaped by a host, must go to an arbitrator. The couple had sued both the host and Airbnb. As per the Airbnb agreement, the couple is bound to have an arbitrator decide whether the dispute can be litigated in court, the judge said.

134.title: SC rejects plea by Maharashtra govt for SIT probe against Anil Deshmukh
134.article_body: Supreme Court has rejected the Maharashtra government's plea demanding a court-monitored Special Investigation Team (SIT) probe against former state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh. CBI's investigation can be biased as former Maharashtra Police chief Subodh Kumar Jaiswal is now the investigating agency's chief, the plea claimed. Deshmukh is being investigated in alleged corruption and bribery cases.

135.title: The ball takes a life of its own when you hit it: Shah Rukh Khan to Andre Russell
135.article_body: After Andre Russell scored 70*(31) to help KKR beat PBKS, KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Welcome back my friend...So long since saw the ball fly so high!" Shah Rukh added, "It takes a life of its own when you hit it...man!" Russell slammed eight sixes against PBKS, the most by a batter in an IPL 2022 match so far.

136.title: Infosys to shut Russia office amid pressure over Ukraine war: Reports
136.article_body: Indian IT major Infosys is closing its office in Russia after facing pressure to stop operating amid Russia's war with Ukraine, reports said. Earlier, UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak faced questions over his wife Akshata's stake in Infosys, which was co-founded by her father Narayana Murthy. Infosys is trying to find replacement roles abroad for Moscow employees, BBC reported.

137.title: 36-year-old woman in Gujarat moves HC seeking 'No Religion, No Caste' certificate
137.article_body: A 36-year old woman from Surat has moved Gujarat High Court with a petition seeking the court's directions to the authorities to issue her a 'No Religion, No Caste' certificate. Kajal Manjula, who originally belongs to Rajgor Brahmin community, stated that she has had to face "so many troubles in her life due to discriminatory caste system".

138.title: Kabir Singh was a modern aggressive version of SRK's Devdas: Shahid
138.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said his character in 'Kabir Singh' was a "modern aggressive version" of Shah Rukh Khan's character in the 2002 film 'Devdas'. "It is a man who destroys himself out of love for someone...The only difference is that man is reactive, aggressive," he added. 'Kabir Singh' was a remake of the 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy'.

139.title: SRK's son AbRam prays for KKR with fingers crossed during IPL match, pic viral
139.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's eight-year-old son AbRam was spotted praying for KKR at the stadium during their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. Shah Rukh's daughter Suhana took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture of AbRam, writing, "Think it worked." KKR defeated PBKS by six wickets, chasing down a 138-run target in 14.3 overs.

140.title: Law enforcement agencies get email threatening to kill PM, execute 20 attacks
140.article_body: Law enforcement agencies have confirmed that they had received an email threatening to kill PM Narendra Modi. "I have more than 20 RDX and I have planned 20 big attacks," the email stated. "We get such emails and letters at least once a month...But we are still not completely disregarding it and will track down the sender," an officer said.

141.title: Retreating Russians leaving mines around homes, bodies: Zelenskyy
141.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned people that retreating Russian forces are creating "a complete disaster" outside the capital Kyiv. "They're mining the whole territory. They're mining homes...equipment, even the bodies of people who were killed," he said. Zelenskyy urged residents to wait to resume their lives until they're assured the mines have been cleared and there's no danger.

142.title: Mumbai saw over 16,000 properties sale registration in March 2022: Data
142.article_body: Property sale registrations in Mumbai touched over 16,000 units in March 2022, contributing nearly ₹1,131 crore to the state's revenue, according to data by Maharashtra's Inspector General of Registration. Maximum registrations were in the price band of ₹1-5 crore and homes ranging between 500-1,000 sq ft were the most preferred category of properties registered in March 2022, the data revealed.

143.title: Bulldozers used in anti-encroachment drive in Bihar; video surfaces
143.article_body: A video has surfaced after Bihar State Housing Board used bulldozers in a drive to clear land encroachments in Patna's Rajiv Nagar. Multiple unauthorised buildings that had been constructed on the land which was marked for state police have been cleared. Earlier, Uttar Pradesh Police threatened to raze the houses of two rape accused with bulldozers if they don't surrender.

144.title: HC tells woman to pay ₹3,000/month to ex-husband in alimony case
144.article_body: Bombay High Court has directed a woman who works as a teacher to pay interim maintenance of ₹3,000/month to her divorced husband, saying that alimony can be claimed by either of the spouses. The former husband alleged that he has no income and had encouraged his wife to study while he managed the household. The plea seeks ₹15,000/month as alimony.

145.title: India reports 1,260 new COVID-19 cases, 83 deaths in last 24 hours
145.article_body: India has reported 1,260 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 13,445. Meanwhile, the death toll due to COVID-19 in the country has risen to 5,21,264 after 83 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. India's total vaccination number is 1,84,52,44,856.

146.title: Kalicharan Maharaj, held over remarks against Mahatma Gandhi, gets bail
146.article_body: Self-proclaimed 'Godman' Kalicharan Maharaj, who was arrested in connection with a hate speech case, was granted bail after three months by the Chhattisgarh High Court on Friday. He was arrested under sedition charges for making derogatory remarks against Mahatma Gandhi at a 'Dharam Sansad'. Kalicharan was held by Raipur Police from Madhya Pradesh's Khajuraho on December 30, 2021.

147.title: Coin toss happened twice in the 2011 World Cup final
147.article_body: The coin was tossed twice in the 2011 World Cup final, which India won against Sri Lanka 11 years ago on April 2. MS Dhoni and Kumar Sangakkara both thought they had won the toss in the first attempt. Referee Jeff Crowe said he had not heard Sangakkara's call, after which the toss was redone and won by Sri Lanka.

148.title: Gautam Adani's fortune hits $100 billion mark, surpasses Mukesh Ambani's
148.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth has hit the $100 billion mark after surging by nearly $24 billion this year. He's the world's biggest gainer this year and now the world's 10th richest person, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani has overtaken Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, whose fortune stands at $99 billion, and become Asia's richest person again.

149.title: Will strengthen western borders so no one can think of attacking us: Russia
149.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin had ordered the military to strengthen the country's western borders "so that it wouldn't cross anyone's mind...to attack us", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday. Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu is working on a security plan, he added. Peskov alleged that unnamed nations were strengthening their military potential near Russia's western borders.

150.title: Meta staff to no longer require COVID-19 booster shots in the US
150.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta is no longer requiring its US employees to have COVID-19 boosters to enter its offices. "We updated our requirements in early March to align with CDC guidance, and now COVID-19 boosters are no longer required for entry," a Meta spokesperson said. However, its requirement of a 1- or 2-shot series of vaccination is still in place.

151.title: BBMP uploads budget online, breaks tradition of presenting it before public
151.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) for the first time uploaded the Budget for the 2022-23 fiscal on its website barely an hour before the end of March 31 which was the last day of the financial year 2021-22. The BBMP uploaded the budget online without any prior announcement and broke the traditional practice of presenting Budget before the media.

152.title: 5.5 lakh households in Ghaziabad to get unique IDs over property tax
152.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has decided to issue an 18-digit unique identification number to about 5.5 lakh households under its jurisdiction, officials said. About 1.68 lakh properties were never charged property tax, as per a GIS-based survey conducted by the civic body. "In future, the unique number may also be used for the provision of services," an official added.

153.title: Thane man falls from train into Mumbra creek; rescue op halted due to high tide
153.article_body: A 34-year-old man fell from a train into a creek in Thane's Mumbra on Friday, according to the civic body. Police said the man, who was taking his mother to a hospital in Ghatkopar, lost his balance when the train reached the bridge above the creek. Officials had launched a rescue operation, which was later halted due to high tide.

154.title: Explosion sounds on Shah's route in B'luru cause security scare
154.article_body: Explosion sounds heard on Union Minister Amit Shah's route in Bengaluru caused a security scare on Friday. After a police investigation, it was reportedly found that the explosion was due to a short circuit in the sewage system's underground electric cables in Vasanth Nagar area. The area was completely cleared for a security inspection to be certain of the cause.

155.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency amid protests over economic crisis
155.article_body: Sri Lanka has declared a nationwide state of emergency after protests over the country's worst economic crisis in decades turned violent. In a gazette notification, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said the decision was taken in the interests of public security. On Thursday, hundreds of protesters clashed with police outside Rajapaksa's house after tear gas was fired. Over 50 people were arrested.

156.title: Sachin Tendulkar had not let Virender Sehwag watch 2011 World Cup final live
156.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar hadn't let Virender Sehwag watch the 2011 World Cup final live, and neither watched it himself, despite being in the dressing room when India were chasing the 275-run target. Sachin revealed that in an earlier match, when they were getting a massage, India played well. Sachin stopped Sehwag from watching the final because of the same superstition.

157.title: NCB's witness in Aryan Khan drug case Prabhakar Sail dies due to heart attack
157.article_body: Prabhakar Sail, who was NCB's panch witness in the Mumbai cruise drug case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan, passed away due to heart attack on Friday. He was an independent witness and had accused NCB officials of extortion. Sail was the bodyguard of NCB witness Kiran Gosavi, the self-styled private detective whose selfie with Aryan went viral.

158.title: MS Dhoni's 2011 World Cup final bat is the most expensive bat ever
158.article_body: The bat MS Dhoni used to hit the 2011 World Cup final-winning six holds the record for being the most expensive cricket bat in history. Dhoni's bat was bought by Mumbai-based brokerage firm RK Global for £100,000 (then ₹72 lakh) at a charity dinner in London, three months after the final. The proceedings went to Dhoni's wife's charitable organisation.

159.title: Day temperatures in Pune likely to touch 40°C in next few days: IMD
159.article_body: As per India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials, the day temperatures in Pune may increase to 40°C in the next few days. "The sky is likely to remain clear. The night temperature in the city is likely to be around 15°C," IMD Pune's scientist Anupam Kashyapi said. According to Kashyapi, heatwave conditions in Maharashtra are likely to continue.

160.title: Gang kidnaps LPG cylinder delivery staff, extorts ₹2 lakh in Pune
160.article_body: Three people were arrested after a gang of six allegedly kidnapped two LPG cylinder delivery staff by intercepting the auto while posing as crime branch officials. The gang accused the staff of selling the cylinders in black market and demanded that they pay ₹5 lakh, but later released them after extorting ₹2 lakh from the duo's families, according to police.

161.title: Will Smith resigns from Oscars Academy over Chris slap, says 'I betrayed their trust'
161.article_body: Actor Will Smith has resigned from the Oscars Academy after slapping comedian Chris Rock on stage during last Sunday's ceremony. "My actions at...94th Academy Awards presentation were shocking, painful, and inexcusable," he said. Will added, "I betrayed the trust of the Academy. I deprived other nominees and winners of their opportunity to celebrate and be celebrated for their extraordinary work."

162.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 10th time in 12 days
162.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹102.61/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹93.87/litre from ₹93.07/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.

163.title: Delhi biker falls after getting entangled in kite string, loses ₹3 lakh
163.article_body: A 55-year-old man, who was carrying ₹6 lakh, fell off his bike after getting entangled in a kite string in Delhi's Shastri Park, police said. Following the accident, ₹3 lakh was stolen from him, police added. A loose kite string got entangled around the victim's neck, causing him to lose balance and fall on the road, police further said.

164.title: 45-yr-old man dies after AC compressor explodes at house in Gurugram
164.article_body: A 45-year-old man died after an air-conditioner compressor exploded, causing a fire at his house in Gurugram on Friday morning, police said. The deceased man was sleeping in his room when the incident took place. "Due to heavy smoke and suffocation, he could not even cry for help. He was charred to death in the fire," a police official said.

165.title: Groups for FIFA World Cup 2022 announced; Spain, Germany in same group
165.article_body: Four-time champions Germany and FIFA World Cup 2010 winners Spain will face each other in the group stage of FIFA World Cup 2022. The tournament's defending champions France have been placed along with Denmark and Tunisia in Group D. Meanwhile, hosts Qatar have been placed along with Ecuador, Senegal and Netherlands in Group A.

166.title: Can anyone not be happy for him: Bhogle on Umesh's 8 wickets in 3 IPL games
166.article_body: Complimenting Umesh Yaadav after he became highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022, commentator Harsha Bhogle said, "Can anyone not be happy for Umesh. Only two games in the last two years and already eight wickets in three games." He added, "He is bowling as well as he has [been]." Posting 4-1-23-4 against PBKS, Umesh registered his best-ever bowling figures in IPL.

167.title: Strong man in purple form: Harbhajan on Umesh's 4 wickets in KKR vs PBKS
167.article_body: Praising KKR pacer Umesh Yaadav on picking four wickets against PBKS and becoming highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with total eight wickets from three matches, Harbhajan Singh said, "Strong man Umesh in purple form for team purple and gold- KKR." He tweeted, "Keep it up champion." KKR bowled-out PBKS at 137 in 18.2 overs. Umesh registered bowling figures of 4-1-23-4.

168.title: KKR defeat PBKS as Andre Russell smashes most sixes in an IPL 2022 match so far
168.article_body: KKR chased down the target of 138 runs in 14.3 overs against PBKS to register their second win in IPL 2022. The match witnessed Andre Russell smash eight maximums, the most sixes hit by a batter in IPL 2022 so far. Russell scored 70*(31) and stitched an unbeaten 90-run partnership with Sam Billings to help KKR win.

169.title: Germany has reached peak of Omicron wave of COVID-19: Health agency
169.article_body: Germany's health agency Robert Koch Institute (RKI) on Thursday said Germany has reached the peak of the Omicron wave of COVID-19. Germany on Thursday reported 274,901 new COVID-19 cases. Around 76% of the population is fully vaccinated with nearly 60% of people having received a booster shot. RKI said "more than 1.5 million COVID-19 cases were reported within one week."

170.title: Rupee-rouble trade has been ongoing for years: Russian Foreign Minister
170.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, who's visiting India, said on Friday that the rupee-rouble payments system has been going on for many years. "The reason for moving towards national currencies...is the unreliable nature of our Western counterparts," he added. He further said, "We don't want to be a part of a system whose masters can steal your money overnight."

171.title: TN govt reserves 2 berths for women in SETC sleeper buses
171.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Transport Department on Friday announced that two berths, 1 LB and 4 LB, will be reserved for women in all AC and non-AC sleeper buses run by State Express Transport Corporation. If both berths aren't booked before departure, driver or conductor may change them to general category. Women can either reserve seats online or at ticket counters.

172.title: Amazon workers at NY warehouse vote to form company's first US union
172.article_body: Workers at an Amazon warehouse in New York's Staten Island have voted in favour of forming a union, making it the e-commerce giant's first facility in the US to organise. The workers secured a majority as 2,654 voted in favour of joining the union, while 2,131 opposed. Amazon is the second largest private employer in the US, Reuters said.

173.title: Bulldozers have started crushing people under BJP rule: Akhilesh
173.article_body: Criticising the BJP, Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav has said that bulldozers have started crushing people under the party's rule. "Inflation is increasing day by day. The government is playing with lives of people by being insensitive and careless," he added. Notably, the BJP had promoted "bulldozer" as a symbol of development and action against criminals during UP Assembly polls.
