349.title: Electricity tariffs increased by 2.68% in Uttarakhand: UERC
349.article_body: Electricity tariffs have been increased by 2.68% in the state, Uttarakhand Electricity Regulatory Commission (UERC) confirmed. The electricity rate has been hiked by ₹0.4 per unit for BPL and snowbound consumers, UERC informed. Accordingly, the revised domestic electricity rates are ₹2.90, ₹4.20, ₹5.80, ₹6.55 for 0-100 units, 101-200 units, 201-400 units, above 400 units categories, respectively.

350.title: Illegal business expenses of ₹800 crore found at Hero MotoCorp: I-T Dept
350.article_body: The Income Tax Department found illegal business expenses of over ₹800 crore after it conducted a search and seizure operation at Hero MotoCorp's premises. It said that ₹60 crore in "unaccounted" cash was used to purchase 10 acre of farm land in Delhi. "The ultimate...beneficiary of the land deal is a prominent person of the automobile manufacturer group," it added.

351.title: CSK could have won if dropped catches vs LSG were taken: Ravindra Jadeja
351.article_body: Reacting to CSK losing their first two matches of an IPL season for the first time ever after a defeat against LSG, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they could have won if two catches dropped were taken. Moeen Ali dropped Quinton De Kock, while Tushar Deshpande failed to complete KL Rahul's catch during the match.

352.title: After Bombay HC order, provisional aggregator licence issued to Ola, Uber
352.article_body: Four cab service companies, including Ola and Uber, have been issued a provisional aggregator licence for operating taxi services in the city by  Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA). Notably, last month, the Bombay High Court had instructed all app-based cab aggregators to apply for a valid licence, after finding them without one, to continue operations in the city.

353.title: Telangana makes wearing masks optional, removes all COVID-19 curbs
353.article_body: In view of declining COVID-19 cases over the past few weeks, the Telangana government on Friday lifted all COVID-19-related restrictions in the state. The state government has announced that wearing face masks will be optional with effect from April 1. However, it has asked pregnant women, senior citizens and people with co-morbidities to continue following the COVID-19 guidelines.

354.title: Adani gains $21 billion in 3 months, more than the world's 5 richest men
354.article_body: Asia's second richest person and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's fortune has surged by $21.1 billion so far this year, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. He made more money than the world's five richest people, including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffett, in three months. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's fortune surged $8.24 billion in the same period.

355.title: Kangana praises Rajamouli's 'RRR', says 'nationalism is my favourite subject'
355.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has praised SS Rajamouli's latest film 'RRR', saying that it has everything that a film should have. Calling it an amazing film, she added, "Nationalism is my favourite subject." "This is a blockbuster movie that we've watched in 3D after a long time, long live Rajamouli," Kangana further said. 'RRR' stars Jr NTR, Ram Charan and Alia Bhatt.

356.title: '360-degree player' Badoni is a great find for Indian cricket: Rahul
356.article_body: Talking about Ayush Badoni who helped LSG record their maiden win in IPL history with an unbeaten 19 off 9 balls against CSK, KL Rahul said Badoni is a great find for Indian cricket. "Badoni's been phenomenal. He's strong, a 360-degree player who can bowl," added Rahul. LSG defeated CSK by six wickets after being handed a target of 211.

357.title: Trainee DSP's wife dies by suicide less than 4 months after marriage in UP
357.article_body: A trainee Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP)'s wife allegedly died by suicide in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur less than four months after their marriage, police said. The 30-year-old woman was found hanging from a ceiling fan in a room of their residence, police added. She was pursuing a Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medicine and Surgery (BAMS) from Lucknow, SP Vipin Mishra said.

358.title: Govt not planning a law soon to regulate cryptocurrencies: Report
358.article_body: The government isn't planning a law soon to either regulate or tighten provisions relating to cryptocurrencies, Bloomberg reported on Friday. The Indian government will frame a law for cryptocurrencies only after a global consensus emerges on regulating such assets, the report added. During the Budget, the government announced a 30% tax on income from virtual digital assets from April 1.

359.title: Russia warns agriculture supplies could be limited to 'friends'
359.article_body: Deputy Secretary of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, warned that Russia, a major global wheat exporter, could limit supplies of agriculture products to only "friendly" countries amid Western sanctions imposed on Moscow over the Ukraine invasion.  "Fortunately, we have plenty of them [friendly countries], and they are not in Europe or North America at all," the former President added.

360.title: Russia jamming commercial planes' satellite navigation: France
360.article_body: France's civil aviation authority DGAC has claimed Russia's military has been jamming satellite navigation systems used by commercial aircraft since the Ukraine invasion. Pilots have been reporting disruptions in regions around the Black Sea, eastern Finland and the Kaliningrad enclave. The equipment typically used to protect troops and installations against GPS-guided missiles is being targeted.

361.title: Uber & Google PMs to teach Product Management bootcamp: Masters’ Union
361.article_body: Masters’ Union has announced that in collaboration with product managers (PMs) from Uber, Google, Spinny and other top startups, it is launching a four-month intensive PM Bootcamp. It added that average CTCs recorded are up to ₹45 lakh and in addition to placement, the hands-on bootcamp will strictly focus on prototyping, wireframing, analytics, product-led growth and portfolio development.

362.title: First complete, gapless human genome sequence published
362.article_body: The Telomere-to-Telomere consortium of scientists has published the first complete, gapless sequence of a human genome. This comes two decades after Human Genome Project produced the first draft human genome sequence. Scientists say that having a complete sequence of the roughly 3 billion bases (or 'letters') in our DNA will help them understand all the functional nuances of human genome.

363.title: It doesn’t matter who you are playing with: Badoni on learnings at LSG
363.article_body: Sharing the lessons he has learnt at LSG, batter Ayush Badoni said, "The best thing I have learnt...is to be yourself. Be natural and...it doesn't matter who you are playing with or against." Badoni scored an unbeaten 19 off 9 balls in LSG's match against CSK, having scored 54 off 41 balls in the franchise's IPL 2022 opener against GT.

364.title: When will PM Modi hold 'Pareshani Pe Charcha': NCP on fuel price hike
364.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) criticised PM Narendra Modi over fuel price hike and unemployment and asked when will he organise 'Parseshani Pe Charcha (interaction on hardships)'. "Students are under stress during the exam period. We thank PM for interacting with them...But when is he going to hold 'Pareshani Pe Charcha' to address concerns...of common people?" NCP's Clyde Crasto said.

365.title: Pune civic body registers record revenue collection in 2021-22
365.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation registered a record revenue collection in the year 2021-22, which included ₹2,002 crore collected as building development charges and ₹1,845.91 crore as property taxes. The civic body had collected ₹508 crore in 2020-21 and ₹770 crore in 2019-20 as building development charges. An official said that 70% of the people paid their property taxes online.

366.title: Australia to send armoured vehicles requested by Ukrainian Prez
366.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison said the country would send armoured Bushmaster vehicles to Ukraine. This comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy specifically asked for them during an address to the Australian Parliament on Thursday. Morrison added that Australia is "not just sending our prayers" but "we're sending our guns...our munitions...humanitarian aid" and more to war-hit Ukraine.

367.title: Bajrang Dal activists assault Muslim man for selling halal meat in Karnataka
367.article_body: A group of Bajrang Dal activists allegedly assaulted a Muslim vendor in Karnataka's Bhadravathi for selling halal meat at his chicken shop, police said. An FIR has been registered and police have initiated a probe in this connection. The incident comes a day after CM Basavaraj S Bommai said he will look into serious objections raised against halal meat.

368.title: Choreographer Ganesh Acharya charged with stalking, voyeurism, sexual harassment
368.article_body: The Mumbai Police have filed a chargesheet against choreographer Ganesh Acharya, who was booked for alleged sexual harassment in 2020. Acharya has been charged with stalking, sexual harassment and voyeurism. A complaint was filed in 2020 by a choreographer working with Acharya alleging that he had sexually harassed her after she turned down his advances

369.title: Hyderabad Police arrests Nigerian national in ₹12.48 crore bank hacking case
369.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested a Nigerian national for being involved in a fraudulent transfer from Andhra Pradesh Mahesh Cooperative Urban Bank of ₹12.48 crore by hacking a bank server. Hyderabad Police Commissioner said the bank and the software company used by them for banking security will also be added as co-accused in the case for not following proper security measures.

370.title: Blue Origin makes 4th manned spaceflight, lands crew after 10 minutes
370.article_body: Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin successfully completed its fourth manned mission, with six crew members, to space on Thursday. The crew was landed safely back on Earth 10 minutes after the launch in the US. Earlier, comedian Pete Davidson had been confirmed as a non-paying promotional guest on the six-member flight, but he dropped out later.

371.title: 'X' gender marker to be available for passports in US from April 11
371.article_body: The US government marked Transgender Day of Visibility by announcing that US citizens will be able to select 'X' as the gender marker on their passport applications from April 11. The definition of 'X' gender marker will be "unspecified or another gender identity", it said. The move intends to make federal documents more inclusive for transgender, non-binary and gender-nonconforming people.

372.title: Three members of a family found murdered in Chhattisgarh: Police
372.article_body: Three members of a family, related to each other as mother, son and granddaughter aged 60, 30 and 15, respectively, were allegedly found murdered in a tribal area in Chhattisgarh's Raigad. They were attacked with sharp weapons and crushed to death with stones, police said. They had started living in the forest last month to collect Mahua and other products.

373.title: Gujarat schoolgirl fights off knife-wielding robber; saves sister
373.article_body: An 18-year-old student was injured after she allegedly fought off a robber who put a knife to her throat and saved her sister in Gujarat's Surat. Reportedly, a robber threatened the girl, who was awake due to exams, with a knife while another attempted to attack her sister. The girl apparently pushed knife away and pulled her sister near herself.

374.title: Putin shouldn't be allowed to attend G20 summit: Canadian PM
374.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said he opposes Russian President Vladimir Putin's attendance at 2022 G20 summit in Bali. "Russia has with its illegal invasion of Ukraine upended economic growth for everyone around the world and can't possibly be a constructive partner in how we manage the crisis," he added. Trudeau said he shared his view with Indonesian President Joko Widodo.

375.title: Retaining Russell a large gamble, his bowling a big question mark: Jaffer
375.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said KKR took a large gamble by retaining Andre Russell, adding that it is a big question mark whether he can bowl with the same pace and energy. "Russell was limbering up in his last two overs [while bowling against RCB]," stated Jaffer. Russell conceded 36 runs in 2.2 overs against RCB.

376.title: Dalit student kills self after harassment over non-payment of fees in TN
376.article_body: A 19-year-old Dalit college student in Tamil Nadu’s Nagapattinam killed herself at her home after allegedly being depressed due to harassment over non-payment of college fees, the police said. The deceased identified as Subashini was a physiotherapy student. The girl's relatives and friends blocked road outside Nagapattinam hospital and demanded arrest of correspondent, principal and a  lecturer.

377.title: Guj man arrested for murdering wife, 2 kids, relative; had planned to kill another
377.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife, two teenage children and his wife's grandmother in Gujarat. Police said the accused suspected his wife of having an affair with her boss at a factory. As per reports, the accused had also planned to kill his mother-in-law, but was allegedly shaken after committing four murders and hence spared her.

378.title: Malaika dances with Harnaaz Sandhu on 'Chaiyya Chaiyya', video surfaces
378.article_body: A video of Malaika Arora dancing with Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Sandhu on the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' from the film 'Dil Se' has surfaced online. They performed on 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' at Josh Wakao, an influencer fest held in Mumbai. The original song, sung by Sukhwinder Singh and Sapna Awasthi, featured Shah Rukh Khan and Malaika.

379.title: Speeding vehicle kills pedestrian in Mohali
379.article_body: A pedestrian was killed in a hit and run accident near Balongi in Mohali on Thursday. An onlooker, Jarnail Singh, told the police that a speeding car had hit the pedestrian from behind and sped away. The victim was taken to a hospital in Chandigarh where he eventually died, police said. The unidentified driver is being traced by the police.

380.title: Tesla-rival Rivian lists Ukraine war as reason for 'delays' in ops
380.article_body: Tesla-rival Rivian has blamed the Ukrainian war and the ongoing pandemic and inflation, for "disruptions to and delays" in operations, a regulatory filing revealed. It also counted the conflict as a factor in higher component costs which it said have risen "considerably". In total, Rivian made 13 references to Ukraine in the filing.

381.title: Jamia students stage protest demanding complete reopening of campus
381.article_body: On Thursday, many students from Delhi's Jamia Millia Islamia staged a protest in campus, demanding the complete reopening of the college. They have demanded offline classes for students of all semesters as well as access to the central and departmental libraries for all. Jamia resumed offline classes for undergraduate and postgraduate final year students in March this year.

382.title: Guwahati civic polls postponed to April 21 due to Rongali Bihu festival
382.article_body: The Assam State Election Commission on Thursday postponed the Guwahati Municipal Corporation (GMC) elections to April 21 in view of the Rongali Bihu festival, which will be celebrated from April 14. This comes after several political parties submitted representations to the EC seeking postponement. As per the revised schedule, the counting of votes will now be held on April 24.

383.title: Juvenile found guilty of rioting 20 years later in 2002 Gujarat riots case
383.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who was 15 years old in 2002, has been found guilty of rioting 20 years later in Gulbarg Housing Society massacre during Gujarat riots. A Juvenile Justice Board found him guilty of being part of a mob that attacked the housing society. As many as 69 people, including a former Congress MP, were killed in the massacre.

384.title: Deverakonda, Puri meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh after announcing JGM
384.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, director Puri Jagannadh and the team of 'JGM' met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Delhi on March 30. Producer Charmme Kaur shared some pictures from their meeting on her Twitter handle, along with a caption that read, "Team #JGM meets honourable Defence Minister of India, Rajnath Singh ji." Deverakonda and Charmme had announced the film on March 29.

385.title: Whatever happens offline, same takes place online: PM during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'
385.article_body: Interacting with students, parents and teachers during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' 2022, PM Narendra Modi said that whatever happens offline, the same takes place online. "This means the medium is not the problem. Irrespective of the medium, if our mind is delved into the subject, then it won't make a difference in grasping things," he added.

386.title: Nitish will not leave Bihar: JDU rejects speculation of him going to RS
386.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) refuted rumours of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar going to Rajya Sabha and said that Nitish will not leave Bihar. Taking to Twitter, JDU leader Sanjay Kumar Jha, said, "Shri Kumar has people's mandate to serve Bihar, and will continue to do so for the full term as Chief Minister. He is not going anywhere."

387.title: India voice of developing nations on climate change: Environment Min
387.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said India has emerged as the voice of developing nations on climate change issues. "India is among...few countries that not only set Nationally Determined Contributions in 2015 but achieved them before time," Yadav said in Lok Sabha. He further added that India's lifestyle can teach the world how to live in harmony with the environment.

388.title: What are the income tax rule changes effective from today?
388.article_body: Income from virtual digital assets (VDAs) will be taxed at 30% and losses incurred from one VDA can't be set off against income from another VDA. A cap of tax-free contributions up to ₹2.5 lakh will be imposed on Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) account. A surcharge on long term capital gains tax will be capped at 15% for all assets.

389.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to release in UAE with 0 cuts, director says 'Big victory'
389.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' will release in UAE on April 7. Director Vivek Agnihotri, who had claimed that the film had been "banned" in the country, expressed his happiness on Twitter, writing, "Big victory: Finally, got...censor clearance from UAE." In a statement, Vivek said while some people in India are calling it Islamophobic, an Islamic country passed it with zero cuts.

390.title: Startup founder flags bad roads in B'luru, Telangana Minister says 'move to Hyderabad'
390.article_body: Khatabook's Founder Ravish Naresh tweeted that despite startups in Bengaluru's HSR Layout and Koramangala generating billions of dollars in taxes, the areas' roads are bad and there were power cuts almost daily. "Many rural areas now have better basic infra than India's Silicon Valley," he wrote. Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao replied saying, "Pack your bags and move to Hyderabad."

391.title: Ask yourself when you study online, do you really study or watch reels: PM to students
391.article_body: Addressing students during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha', Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Ask yourself when you study online, do you really study or watch reels on social media?" PM Modi added that it is not the fault of online or offline education because it doesn't matter where you are, but how focused your mind is during the classes.

392.title: Over 16,000 Indian pilgrims visited Pakistan in last 5 yrs: Centre
392.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan informed Rajya Sabha that 16,831 Indian pilgrims visited Pakistan, while 2,119 Pakistani pilgrims visited India, from 2017 to 2021. According to the data, the highest annual number of Indian pilgrims who travelled to Pakistan was in 2021 (5,425), while the highest number of Pakistani pilgrims who came here was in 2017 (984).

393.title: Karnataka court orders probe against BJP minister over hate speech
393.article_body: A court ordered Karnataka Police to conduct a probe against BJP leader and Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister KS Eshwarappa over alleged hate speech. Eshwarappa had suggested that Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killers were Muslims, following which a complaint was filed. Such statements were made with the intention of creating enmity between Hindus and Muslims, as per the complaint.

394.title: Binance wins dismissal of US lawsuit over digital token sales
394.article_body: A US judge has dismissed a lawsuit accusing Binance of violating securities laws by selling unregistered tokens and failing to register as an exchange or broker-dealer. Digital token investors, who had bought nine tokens through Binance starting in 2017, claimed Binance failed to warn them about the "significant risks" of the purchase. The judge said the investors sued too late.

395.title: Man fined $7.2 million over 'Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist'
395.article_body: Canada's Supreme Court asked a man behind the 'Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist' to pay over C$9 million ($7.2 million) fine. Richard Vallières was found guilty in 2016 of trafficking, fraud, and theft of maple syrup worth over $14.4 million between 2011 and 2012. Vallières, at trial, had said he'd sold syrup for $8 million and made an $800,000 profit.

396.title: Bhagwant Mann moves resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab
396.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday moved a resolution in the state Assembly, seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab "for maintaining harmony and taking sentiments of people into account". "Chandigarh city was created as the capital of Punjab. In all past precedents, whenever a state has been divided, the capital remains with the parent state," the resolution stated.

397.title: Making anyone but Harmanpreet captain means repeating a mistake: Anjum
397.article_body: Ex-India captain Anjum Chopra said Harmanpreet Kaur should be India's captain across formats, adding that making anyone else the captain will be a mistake being repeated. Harmanpreet is currently the captain in T20Is with Mithali Raj leading India in ODIs and Test cricket. "Harmanpreet's aggressive approach brings the best out of the Indian team," stated Anjum.

398.title: Didn't share OTP but still lost ₹3.63 lakh: Mumbai woman tells police
398.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai-based woman allegedly lost ₹3.63 lakh to cyber fraud and claimed before the police that she did not share OTP with the fraudster who called her impersonating as a bank official. The victim further told the police that the man asked her to confirm if her number is linked to her net banking account and asked for OTP.

399.title: He played a hell of a knock, unbelievable: De Kock on Evin's 23-ball 55*
399.article_body: LSG opener Quinton De Kock termed batter Evin Lewis's 23-ball 55* against CSK as a hell of a knock and unbelievable, adding that Ayush Badoni's 9-ball 19* was as impressive. "We came out fighting and to come out on top is always special," stated De Kock. LSG recorded their maiden win in IPL history after beating CSK by six wickets.

400.title: Gautam Gambhir's reaction after LSG's win against CSK goes viral
400.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) mentor Gautam Gambhir's reaction after LSG's victory against CSK has gone viral on social media. Gambhir was seen jumping from his chair and throwing a punch in the air as soon as Ayush Badoni hit the winning runs. LSG chased down a target of 211 to win the match.

401.title: There's no truth to this: US on Pak PM's claim of 'foreign conspiracy' to oust him
401.article_body: The US has rejected Pakistan PM Imran Khan's allegations regarding US' role in a "foreign conspiracy" to oust him from power. "There's no truth to these allegations...We respect...Pakistan's constitutional process and the rule of law," the US State Department said. Earlier, Khan, during a speech, named US as the country that threatened them, but immediately retracted its name.

402.title: Police offered to arrest Will Smith, but Chris Rock said 'No, no, no': Oscars producer
402.article_body: Oscars producer Will Packer has said that Los Angeles police were ready to arrest Will Smith after he slapped Chris Rock during the Oscar ceremony. "They said we will go get him...We’re prepared to get him right now. Chris was like, 'No, no, no, I'm fine',"  Packer said. Will had slapped Chris for making a joke about his wife Jada.

403.title: 67-year-old woman from Mumbai loses ₹20 lakh to Bitcoin cyber fraud
403.article_body: A 67-year-old woman from Mumbai lost ₹20 lakh to cyber fraudsters impersonating as employees of a company dealing in Bitcoin investments. She said she saw an advertisement for Bitcoins on her phone and had clicked on the link out of curiosity. She realised she had been defrauded after the accused claimed her invested money was lost due to Ukraine-Russia war.
